alert.note: Alert for McKinley; Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 25 at 4:43PM MDT until August 25 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... Eastern McKinley County in west central New Mexico... * Until 815 PM MDT. * At 443 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain is estimated to have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Strong and slow-moving thunderstorms creating heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Heavy rain will lead to excessive runoff and flash flooding of small creeks and streams, roads as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Torreon Navajo Mission, Ojo Encino and Torreon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas.
